issues.message:
[Error] aria-controls references non-existent id "hidden-categories". Broken ARIA reference provides no accessibility benefit
  How to fix:
    - Add element with matching id
    - Correct the id reference
    - Remove the broken reference
  WCAG 4.1.1: Parsing
  Found: aria-controls="hidden-categories"

[Error] aria-controls references non-existent id "hidden-categories". Broken ARIA reference provides no accessibility benefit
  How to fix:
    - Add element with matching id
    - Correct the id reference
    - Remove the broken reference
  WCAG 4.1.1: Parsing
  Found: aria-controls="hidden-categories"

[Warning] Content may be hidden without visual indication in "Visually hidden utility for screen reader only content
.visually-hidden". Text content may be cut off and inaccessible to users.
  How to fix:
    - Add "text-overflow: ellipsis" to show truncation indicator (...)
    - Or remove "overflow: hidden" to allow text to wrap naturally
    - Or ensure content is accessible through other means (tooltips, expand buttons)
  WCAG 1.4.10: Reflow

[Info] Potential content overflow detected in "h3". This may hide text content inaccessibly.
  How to fix:
    - Verify all content remains accessible when overflow is hidden
    - Consider using "overflow: auto" or "overflow: scroll" for scrollable content
    - Ensure responsive design allows content to reflow at 320px width
  WCAG 1.4.10: Reflow

[Info] Potential content overflow detected in "p". This may hide text content inaccessibly.
  How to fix:
    - Verify all content remains accessible when overflow is hidden
    - Consider using "overflow: auto" or "overflow: scroll" for scrollable content
    - Ensure responsive design allows content to reflow at 320px width
  WCAG 1.4.10: Reflow

[Warning] Animation without prefers-reduced-motion support. Animations can cause vestibular disorders and motion sickness
  How to fix:
    - Add @media (prefers-reduced-motion: reduce) query
    - Disable or reduce animation when preference is set
  WCAG 2.3.3: Animation from Interactions
  Found: File uses transitions without properly disabling them in prefers-reduced-motion: reduce

[Warning] Font size 11px may be too small. Small text is difficult for users with low vision
  How to fix:
    - Use minimum 16px (1rem) for body text
    - Use relative units (rem, em) for scalability
    - Test at 200% zoom
  WCAG 1.4.4: Resize Text
  Found: ".chip-count"

[Error] Highly transparent text is difficult to read. Low opacity reduces effective contrast
  How to fix:
    - Increase opacity to at least 0.55
    - Use solid colors for text
  WCAG 1.4.3: Contrast (Minimum)
  Found: "rgba($color-primary, 0.15)"

[Error] Click handler without keyboard support. Keyboard users cannot activate this element
  How to fix:
    - Add (keydown.enter) or (keydown.space) handler
    - Use <button> instead of <div> or <span>
    - Add tabindex="0" and keyboard event handlers
  WCAG 2.1.1: Keyboard
  Found: <div> (line 76)

[Error] Clickable element missing role. Screen readers cannot identify the element as interactive
  How to fix:
    - Use semantic element: <button>, <a>, <input>
    - Add role="button" with tabindex="0"
    - Add appropriate ARIA role
  WCAG 4.1.2: Name, Role, Value

[Error] Form textarea missing label. Screen readers cannot identify the input purpose
  How to fix:
    - Add <label for="inputId">
    - Add aria-label attribute
    - Add aria-labelledby referencing visible text
    - Wrap input in <label> element
  WCAG 3.3.2: Labels or Instructions
  Found: <textarea matInput [(ngModel)]="editingFaq.answer"...

[Error] mat-icon used as interactive without accessible label. Screen readers cannot announce icon-only buttons
  How to fix:
    - Add aria-label to parent button
    - Add visually-hidden text
    - Add aria-hidden="true" if purely decorative
  WCAG 4.1.2: Name, Role, Value | See: https://material.angular.io/components/icon/overview#accessibility
  Found: <mat-icon>refresh</mat-icon>
